      void gameEndedReset(processing.core.PApplet app, Background map)
      Resets the map to allow for the end screen when the player reaches the goal tile and there are no levels left.

      Returns the list of red enemies still alive.
      java.util.List<YellowEnemy> getYellowEnemies()
      Returns the list of yellow enemies still alive.
      void handleDangerTicks(java.util.List<RedEnemy> redEnemies, java.util.List<YellowEnemy> yellowEnemies, java.util.List<Bomb> bombs, java.util.List<Explosion> explosions)
      Removes enemies that are killed by explosions. Removes bombs that have exploded, and explosions that have been on the map for 0.5 seconds.
      void handleLayerDrawings(processing.core.PApplet app, Player player, java.util.List<RedEnemy> redEnemies, java.util.List<YellowEnemy> yellowEnemies, java.util.List<Bomb> bombs, java.util.List<Explosion> explosions)
      Calls the draw function for the player, enemies, bombs and explosions. Objects with a greater y position will be rendered afterwards.
      void levelUpReset(processing.core.PApplet app, Background map, Timer timer, Player player)
      Resets the map when the player reaches the goal tile and there is still another level to complete.

      Loads in the sprites for either the player, red enemy or yellow enemy
      void setLevelInfo(java.lang.String configPath)
      Reads the configuration file based on configPath and sets the time and path for the first level. Inserts the data for all the levels into levelPaths and levelTimes.

      Loads in the bomb sprites.

      Loads in the topbar (timer and lives) sprites.

        public void levelUpReset(processing.core.PApplet app,
                         Background map,
                         Timer timer,
                         Player player)
        Resets the map when the player reaches the goal tile and there is still another level to complete.
        Parameters:
        app - The PApplet app object
        map - The app's map object
        timer - The app's timer object
        player - The app's player object

      • handleDangerTicks

        public void handleDangerTicks(java.util.List<RedEnemy> redEnemies,
                              java.util.List<YellowEnemy> yellowEnemies,
                              java.util.List<Bomb> bombs,
                              java.util.List<Explosion> explosions)
        Removes enemies that are killed by explosions. Removes bombs that have exploded, and explosions that have been on the map for 0.5 seconds.
        Parameters:
        redEnemies - The list of red enemies
        yellowEnemies - The list of yellow enemies
        bombs - The list of bombs
        explosions - The list of explosions

      • setLevelInfo

        public void setLevelInfo(java.lang.String configPath)
        Reads the configuration file based on configPath and sets the time and path for the first level. Inserts the data for all the levels into levelPaths and levelTimes.
        Parameters:
        configPath - The file path for the configuration JSON file which holds the level data.

      • loadCharacterSprites

        public java.util.List<processing.core.PImage> loadCharacterSprites(processing.core.PApplet app,
                                                                   java.lang.String folderName,
                                                                   java.lang.String characterName,
                                                                   java.lang.String directionName)
        Loads in the sprites for either the player, red enemy or yellow enemy
        Parameters:
        app - The PApplet app object
        folderName - The name of the folder holding the sprites
        characterName - The type of game character
        directionName - The direction of the sprites
        Returns:
        List of sprites.

      • handleLayerDrawings

        public void handleLayerDrawings(processing.core.PApplet app,
                                Player player,
                                java.util.List<RedEnemy> redEnemies,
                                java.util.List<YellowEnemy> yellowEnemies,
                                java.util.List<Bomb> bombs,
                                java.util.List<Explosion> explosions)
        Calls the draw function for the player, enemies, bombs and explosions. Objects with a greater y position will be rendered afterwards.
        Parameters:
        app - The PApplet app object
        player - The app's player object
        redEnemies - The app's redEnemies list
        yellowEnemies - The app's yellowEnemies list
        bombs - The app's bombs list
        explosions - The app's explosions list
